data: First Gentleman in Europe | Battle of Waterloo | Heron Dyke | Norfolk | Bloomsbury Square | London

The First Gentleman in Europe sat upon the throne of his fathers, and the Battle of Waterloo was a stupendous event that still dwelt freshly in menâ€™s memories, when one bright August evening, Gilbert Denison, gentleman, of Heron Dyke, Norfolk, lay dying in his lodgings in Bloomsbury Square, London.
The Mysteries of Heron Dyke: A Novel of Incident. Volume 1
